title: Stick-in-the-Mud: A tale of a village, a custom, and a little boy
description: Through the inventiveness of a small boy too young to be caught up with tradition, the whole village changed its custom.Tomba was a small boy who lived in a village where all the houses were made of mud. When the rains came every year, all the people sat around in the wet. Tomba had an idea that if the huts were put on sticks, they wouldn't have to be uncomfortable. But the villagers had always lived that way and didn't want to listen to a small boy. But many times a new approach to a problem will solve, and Tomba did.
author: Jean Ketchum
